item.title: Series of uneven paving slabs, 18th November

item.title: Blocked road drains, 18th November
item.description:
The drain outside No 42 Malleson Road is blocked. The village is suffering from continuous road flooding during wet weather, this is evidenced of one major cause.Similar debris can be seen in many other drains in the road. Regular cleaning is required.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48,50, Malleson Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footbridge undermined by river, 18th November
item.description:
The footpath/bridge across the River Chelt on the Glynbridge Gardens GL51 0BZ side of the river has been eroded by recent rain and subsequent high/fast flowing river levels. The soil under the bridge has decreased significantly over the last few years, and is now at the point where there is not much soil under the section where the bridge base sits on the Glynbridge Gardens side. My concern is that any further heavy rain/fast flowing river will further erode the soil. This may be a Severn Trent issue to remedy the river bank, but I think I'm correct in saying that Gloucestershire Council are responsible for the bridge, and it's safety.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 135, Carter Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 18th November
item.description:
Customer has called today and has said the trees from the area between the property and m5 are encroaching onto their property and are touching the roof on the lean-to. They have tried to get a tree surgeon to cut these back to the boundary but they say they are unable to get to the area due to the overgrowth. Customer does not have an email address but has been advised to contact NH but also requesting a GCC assist in determining the ownership of trees.
Report on FixMyStreet
